com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.common.ViewObject
      • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapObject
        • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapPolygon

  • public final class MapPolygon
extends MapObject
    A graphical representation of a GeoPolygon to be rendered on a map. In contrast to a MapPolyline, it is assumed that the last coordinate within the path is connected with the first coordinate, thereby constructing an enclosed geometry. Self-intersecting polygons rendering are not supported.
    See Also:
    GeoPolygon

      MapPolygon.CapStyle represents line ending cap rendering styles.

      MapPolygon.PatternStyle represents available patterns styles for Line or Border.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapPolygon

        public MapPolygon()
        Creates a MapPolygon, which is a MapObject in the shape of a polygon.

      • MapPolygon

        public MapPolygon(GeoPolygon polygon)
        Creates a MapPolygon, which is a MapObject in the shape of a polygon.
        Parameters:
        polygon - GeoPolygon to construct the MapPolygon
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input GeoPolygon is invalid, it is a self-intersecting polygon or vertices are at different altitudes.

    • Method Detail

      • setGeoPolygon

        public MapPolygon setGeoPolygon(GeoPolygon polygon)
        Changes the GeoPolygon rendered by this MapPolygon.
        Parameters:
        polygon - GeoPolygon to be rendered
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolygon itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input GeoPolygon is invalid, it is a self-intersecting polygon or vertices are at different altitudes.

      • getGeoPolygon

        public GeoPolygon getGeoPolygon()
        Gets a copy of the GeoPolygon rendered by this MapPolygon.
        Returns:
        rendered GeoPolygon.

      • setFillColor

        public MapPolygon setFillColor(int color)
        Sets a fill color for this MapPolygon, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component, and 255 meaning 100% contribution
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolygon object itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getFillColor

        public int getFillColor()
        Returns the current fill color for this MapPolygon, returning an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component, and 255 meaning 100% contribution
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • isGeodesicEnabled

        public boolean isGeodesicEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether each segment of this GeoPolygon is drawn as a geodesic.
        Returns:
        true if GeoPolygon segments are drawn as a geodesic, false otherwise.

      • setGeodesicEnabled

        public MapPolygon setGeodesicEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Specifies whether to draw each segment of the represented GeoPolygon as a geodesic.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if GeoPolygon segments will be drawn as a geodesic
        Returns:
        The updated @ code MapPolygon} itself.

      • setLineColor

        public MapPolygon setLineColor(int color)
        Sets a line color for this MapPolygon, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. The default line color is Color.BLUE.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255] with 0 meaning no contribution for that component, and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolygon itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getLineColor

        public int getLineColor()
        Gets the current line color for this MapPolygon, returning an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setLineWidth

        public MapPolygon setLineWidth(int width)
        Sets a line width, in pixels, for this MapPolygon, an int value within the [0..100] range. By default, the line width is 1.
        Parameters:
        width - Desired width of the line defining the MapPolygon.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolygon itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is width is out of range.

      • setDashPrimaryLength

        public MapPolygon setDashPrimaryLength(int length)
        Sets a length, in pixels, for the primary dash segment of a dashed MapPolygon. By default, the primary dash length is 1.
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of the primary dash
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolygon itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is less than or equal to 0.
        See Also:
        MapPolygon.setDashSecondaryLength(int)

      • setDepthTestEnabled

        public void setDepthTestEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set whether to render MapPolygon with depth test.

        Rendering with depth test should be used if map object altitude is relevant in your application. Rendering objects with different heights while disabling depth test may cause object occlusion.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if MapPolygon is rendered with depth test.

      • getDepthTestEnabled

        public boolean getDepthTestEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the MapPolygon is rendered with depth test. By default, depth test is disabled.
        Returns:
        True if the MapPolygon is rendered with depth test, false otherwise.

      • isPerspectiveEnabled

        public boolean isPerspectiveEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the MapPolygon appears thinner further away when the map is tilted. By default, perspective is disabled. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        true if the MapPolygon has perspective enabled, false otherwise.

      • setPerspectiveEnabled

        public MapPolygon setPerspectiveEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the width of this MapPolygon to be thinner further away when the map is tilted. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        enabled - A boolean specifying whether the MapPolygon should have perspective enabled.
        Returns:
        The updated child of MapPolygon itself.

      • setPatternStyle

        public MapPolygon setPatternStyle(MapPolygon.PatternStyle style)
        Sets new patter style for line/border. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        style - one of MapPolygon.PatternStyle available.
        Returns:
        The updated child of MapPolygon itself.

      • getPatternStyle

        public MapPolygon.PatternStyle getPatternStyle()
        Method retrieves current pattern of line/border. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        current MapPolygon.PatternStyle value.

      • setCustomPattern

        public MapPolygon setCustomPattern(Image icon)
        Specifies patter image. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        icon - image to be used as pattern, it is recommended to use icons with dimensions which are pow of 2.
        Returns:
        The updated child of MapPolygon itself.

      • getCustomPattern

        public final Image getCustomPattern()
        Returns pattern image. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        Image object with previously user defined pattern.
